snippet: The habenula helps keep track of painful experiences and might be linked to motivation, a finding that could help in the treatment of depression.
abstract: Study in journal The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences concludes that tiny part of brain known as habenula keeps track of painful experiences and helps determine how we will react to them in future.
lead_paragraph: The habenula helps keep track of painful experiences and might be linked to motivation, a finding that could help in the treatment of depression.
